Play Now top definitions quizzes related content examples explore dictionary british medical rape reyp SHOW IPA reɪp /PHONETIC RESPELLING SEE SYNONYMS FOR rape ON THESAURUS.COM noun unlawful sexual intercourse or any other sexual penetration of the vagina, anus, or mouth of another person, with or without force, by sex organ, other body part, or foreign object, without the consent of the victim.
an act of plunder, violent seizure, or abuse; despoliation; violation: the rape of the countryside.
Archaic. the act of seizing and carrying off by force.
SEE MORESEE LESS verb used with object raped, rap·ing.
to commit the crime of rape on person to plunder place despoil: The logging operation raped wide tract of forest without regard for the environmental impact of their harvesting practices.
to seize, take, or carry off by force.
SEE MORESEE LESS verb used without object raped, rap·ing.
to commit rape.

Question of 10 asset expert skill or knowledge; expertness; know-how.
useful and desirable thing or quality.
Origin of rape 1350–1400; Middle English Middle French Latin rāpum neuter rāpa feminine turnip; cognate with Greek rhápys Definition for rape of rape3 reyp SHOW IPA reɪp /PHONETIC RESPELLING noun the residue of grapes, after the juice has been extracted, used as filter in making vinegar.
Origin of rape 1590–1600; French râpe Germanic; compare Old High German raspōn to scrape Dictionary.com Unabridged Based on the Random House Unabridged Dictionary, Random House, Inc.

1979, 1986 HarperCollins Publishers 1998, 2000, 2003, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2009, 2012 Medical definitions for rape rape rāp n.
The crime of forcing another person to submit to sex acts, especially sexual intercourse.
v. To commit rape on.
Other words from rape rap′ist n.
